title: Kenyan avocado farm faces more claims of abuse
description: As the company tries to win back the UK business it lost, more alleged victims have come forward.

title: The dilemma of rebuilding Gaza without rearming Hamas
description: Donors are grappling with the challenge of helping Gaza without benefitting its militant rulers.

title: Why it is no longer cool to be a crazy rich Asian in China
description: Netizens are outraged by the sky-high incomes of some people in China amid a gaping wealth gap.

title: Keeping Up With the Kardashians: 8 ways one family became a hot topic
description: As the series ends, we look at how the Kardashians became an office cooler conversation.

title: Sacred objects: From police evidence to museum pieces
description: Sacred objects seized from practitioners of Afro-Brazilian religions are being returned after decades.

title: Why classical musicians are performing among tombstones
description: The New York Philharmonic is back, playing to a live - and not-so-live - audience.

title: 'I can speak freely and use swear words as I see fit'
description: The rise of email "newsletter" providers that allow writers to directly connect with readers.

title: 'Miraculous' mosquito hack cuts dengue by 77%
description: Infecting the mosquitoes with a different bug slams the brakes on dengue fever, trial finds.

title: G7: What it's all about in 60 seconds
description: Jon Kay tells us what is happening ahead of this weekend's G7 summit in just one minute.

title: Covid in India: The mother and son feeding Mumbai's poor
description: Harsh Mandavia and his mother have provided more than 25,000 meals to people hit by the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Covid: How should I protect myself from Covid now?
description: What are the actions we can take to reduce our risk of catching the virus?

title: Sweet dreams! Wandering elephants take a snooze
description: A herd of 15 elephants on the move is China has been spotted having a nap in a forest.

title: Covid: What do we know about global youth unemployment?
description: Young people have suffered from the economic consequences of Covid.

title: Government acted unlawfully over firm's £560,000 Covid contract
description: A High Court judge criticises awarding a contract to a company run by Dominic Cummings's friends.

title: Parkrun 'fearful for future' as it writes to PM Boris Johnson asking for support
description: Parkrun writes to Prime Minister Boris Johnson warning a further delay to its return is now "likely" and that it is now "fearful for our future."

title: An ignorant minority who need educating - Ferdinand on those that boo 'taking a knee'
description: The people booing England players taking a knee are an "ignorant minority" who need "educating", says former England captain Rio Ferdinand.

title: G7 summit: Don't imperil NI peace, Biden to warn UK and EU
description: The US president will warn that UK-EU negotiations must protect the Good Friday Agreement, his adviser says.

title: Crocodile attack: British family's fears as saved twin gets sepsis
description: The British twins' older sister says Melissa is in a "really serious" condition in hospital in Mexico.

title: Halogen lightbulb sales to be banned in UK under climate change plans
description: September's ban will cut carbon emissions and save consumers money, the government says.

title: One Fastly customer triggered internet meltdown
description: The unnamed customer was not to blame but changing settings triggered a software bug, Fastly says.

title: Queen's portrait removed after vote by Oxford University students
description: Oxford University students vote to remove the image as it is deemed a symbol of "colonial history".

title: Wolves appoint former Benfica boss Lage as manager
description: Wolves appoint former Benfica boss Bruno Lage as their new manager.

title: Halo Trust: Afghanistan mine clearance workers shot dead 'in cold blood'
description: Officials blamed the Taliban, but the Halo Trust says the local Taliban group came to their aid.

title: Andrew Lloyd Webber 'prepared to be arrested' over theatre reopening
description: The impresario says he will open his new production of Cinderella "come hell or high water".

title: Driver sacked for drinking in club while sick wins tribunal
description: A driver did not break company rules by going to a social club while off work, a tribunal finds.

title: Watch: Parachute pitch invader halts Polish league match
description: Watch as an unexpected pitch invader on a parachute halts a Polish league match between Olimpia Elblag and PISA Primavera Barczewo.

title: England v India: Emily Arlott included in hosts' 17-woman squad
description: Uncapped Emily Arlott has been included in England's 17-woman squad for the upcoming Test against India.

title: Harry and Meghan did not ask Queen to use Lilibet name - Palace source
description: But a spokesperson for Prince Harry and Meghan insists the Queen was asked, and was supportive.

title: G7: 'Mount Recyclemore' of leaders made from electronic waste in Cornwall
description: The sculptor says his work highlights the need to make electronic devices more reusable.

title: Newspaper headlines: Lockdown end uncertainty, and Lloyd Webber defiant
description: Reports about whether the planned reopening in England will go ahead on 21 June lead many newspapers.

title: Harry Kane: Tracking England captain's evolution into world-class scoring machine
description: From sitting on the bench to becoming a scoring machine and the Premier League's best creator, we track Harry Kane's footballing evolution.
